page.title: 13Occupations - Niton Area
page.content: Farming,the tourist trade,local trade and some market gardening provide most of the employment in the area.Very little fishing is done compared with the past,and the crabs,for which Niton was once famous,are the most provitabe catches. In a survey of 53 families carried out in June 1985 by Class 4 at Niton C.P School there were 6 fathers working in Niton,38 in other parts of the Island (10 being mobile),4 worked on the mainland,2 abroad and 2 at sea.There were 2 unemployed.Half the mothers had jobs.The unemployment on the Island is higher than the rest of the South- East England,but lower than the national average.It fluctuates considerably from 13.9% in the summer to 17% in the winter due to the seasonal work of the Tourist Industry.
